segment.source: description: This roadmap provides an overview of key enterprise features for Windows 10&\#160;Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.'
segment.target: description: This roadmap provides an overview of key enterprise features for Windows 10&\#160;Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.'

segment.source: title: Enterprise
segment.target: title: Enterprise

segment.source: Enterprise
segment.target: Enterprise

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: This roadmap provides an overview of key enterprise features for Windows 10 Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
segment.target: This roadmap provides an overview of key enterprise features for Windows 10 Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

segment.source: Windows 10 lets you write once and deploy across all devices, creating one app that tailors to any device.
segment.target: Windows 10 lets you write once and deploy across all devices, creating one app that tailors to any device.

segment.source: This lets you build the great experiences your users expect, while providing control over the security, management, and configuration required by your organization.
segment.target: This lets you build the great experiences your users expect, while providing control over the security, management, and configuration required by your organization.

segment.source: Note This article is targeted towards developers writing enterprise UWP apps.
segment.target: Note This article is targeted towards developers writing enterprise UWP apps.

segment.source: For general UWP development, see the How-to guides for Windows 10 apps.
segment.target: For general UWP development, see the How-to guides for Windows 10 apps.

segment.source: For WPF, Windows Forms, or Win32 development, visit the Desktop dev center.
segment.target: For WPF, Windows Forms, or Win32 development, visit the Desktop dev center.

segment.source: For IT professional resources, like deploying Windows 10 or managing enterprise security features, see Windows 10 on TechNet.
segment.target: For IT professional resources, like deploying Windows 10 or managing enterprise security features, see Windows 10 on TechNet.

segment.source: Security
segment.target: Security

segment.source: Windows 10 provides a suite of security features for app developers to protect the identity of their users, the security of corporate networks, and any business data stored on devices.
segment.target: Windows 10 provides a suite of security features for app developers to protect the identity of their users, the security of corporate networks, and any business data stored on devices.

segment.source: New for Windows 10 is Microsoft Passport, an easy-to-deploy two-factor password alternative that is accessible by using a PIN or Windows Hello, which provides enterprise grade security and supports fingerprint, facial, and iris based recognition.
segment.target: New for Windows 10 is Microsoft Passport, an easy-to-deploy two-factor password alternative that is accessible by using a PIN or Windows Hello, which provides enterprise grade security and supports fingerprint, facial, and iris based recognition.

segment.source: Topic
segment.target: Topic

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Intro to secure Windows app development
segment.target: Intro to secure Windows app development

segment.source: This introductory article explains various Windows security features across the stages of authentication, data-in-flight, and data-at-rest.
segment.target: This introductory article explains various Windows security features across the stages of authentication, data-in-flight, and data-at-rest.

segment.source: It also describes how you can integrate those stages into your apps.
segment.target: It also describes how you can integrate those stages into your apps.

segment.source: It covers a large range of topics, and is aimed primarily at helping app architects better understand the Windows features that make creating Universal Windows Platform apps quick and easy.
segment.target: It covers a large range of topics, and is aimed primarily at helping app architects better understand the Windows features that make creating Universal Windows Platform apps quick and easy.

segment.source: Authentication and user identity
segment.target: Authentication and user identity

segment.source: UWP apps have several options for user authentication which are outlined in this article.
segment.target: UWP apps have several options for user authentication which are outlined in this article.

segment.source: For the enterprise, the new Microsoft Passport feature is strongly recommended.
segment.target: For the enterprise, the new Microsoft Passport feature is strongly recommended.

segment.source: Microsoft Passport replaces passwords with strong two-factor authentication (2FA) by verifying existing credentials and by creating a device-specific credential that a biometric or PIN-based user gesture protects, resulting in a both convenient and highly secure experience.
segment.target: Microsoft Passport replaces passwords with strong two-factor authentication (2FA) by verifying existing credentials and by creating a device-specific credential that a biometric or PIN-based user gesture protects, resulting in a both convenient and highly secure experience.

segment.source: Cryptography
segment.target: Cryptography

segment.source: The cryptography section provides an overview of the cryptography features available to UWP apps.
segment.target: The cryptography section provides an overview of the cryptography features available to UWP apps.

segment.source: Articles range from introductory walkthroughs on how to easily encrypt sensitive business data, to advanced to advanced topics such as manipulating cryptographic keys and working with MACs, hashes, and signatures.
segment.target: Articles range from introductory walkthroughs on how to easily encrypt sensitive business data, to advanced to advanced topics such as manipulating cryptographic keys and working with MACs, hashes, and signatures.

segment.source: Data binding and databases
segment.target: Data binding and databases

segment.source: Data binding is a way for your app's UI to display data from an external source, such as a database, and optionally to stay in sync with that data.
segment.target: Data binding is a way for your app's UI to display data from an external source, such as a database, and optionally to stay in sync with that data.

segment.source: Data binding allows you to separate the concern of data from the concern of UI, and that results in a simpler conceptual model as well as better readability, testability, and maintainability of your app.
segment.target: Data binding allows you to separate the concern of data from the concern of UI, and that results in a simpler conceptual model as well as better readability, testability, and maintainability of your app.

segment.source: Topic
segment.target: Topic

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Data binding overview
segment.target: Data binding overview

segment.source: This topic shows you how to bind a control (or other UI element) to a single item or bind an items control to a collection of items in a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.
segment.target: This topic shows you how to bind a control (or other UI element) to a single item or bind an items control to a collection of items in a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.

segment.source: In addition, it shows how to control the rendering of items, implement a details view based on a selection, and convert data for display.
segment.target: In addition, it shows how to control the rendering of items, implement a details view based on a selection, and convert data for display.

segment.source: Entity Framework 7 for UWP
segment.target: Entity Framework 7 for UWP

segment.source: Performing complex queries against large data sets is vastly simplified using Entity Framework 7, which supports UWP.
segment.target: Performing complex queries against large data sets is vastly simplified using Entity Framework 7, which supports UWP.

segment.source: In this walkthrough, you will build a UWP app that performs basic data access against a local SQLite database using Entity Framework.
segment.target: In this walkthrough, you will build a UWP app that performs basic data access against a local SQLite database using Entity Framework.

segment.source: SQLite local database
segment.target: SQLite local database

segment.source: This video is a comprehensive developer's guide to using SQLite, the recommended solution for local app databases.
segment.target: This video is a comprehensive developer's guide to using SQLite, the recommended solution for local app databases.

segment.source: Visit SQLite to download the latest version for UWP, or use the version that's already provided with the Windows 10 SDK.
segment.target: Visit SQLite to download the latest version for UWP, or use the version that's already provided with the Windows 10 SDK.

segment.source: Networking and data serialization
segment.target: Networking and data serialization

segment.source: Line-of-business apps often need to communicate with or store data on a variety of other systems.
segment.target: Line-of-business apps often need to communicate with or store data on a variety of other systems.

segment.source: This is typically accomplished by connecting to a network service (using protocols such as REST or SOAP) and then serializing or deserializing data into a common format.
segment.target: This is typically accomplished by connecting to a network service (using protocols such as REST or SOAP) and then serializing or deserializing data into a common format.

segment.source: Working with networks and data serialization in UWP apps similar to WPF, WinForms, and ASP.NET applications.
segment.target: Working with networks and data serialization in UWP apps similar to WPF, WinForms, and ASP.NET applications.

segment.source: See the following articles for more information.
segment.target: See the following articles for more information.

segment.source: Topic
segment.target: Topic

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Networking basics
segment.target: Networking basics

segment.source: This walkthrough explains basic networking concepts relevant to all UWP apps, regardless of the communication protocols in use.
segment.target: This walkthrough explains basic networking concepts relevant to all UWP apps, regardless of the communication protocols in use.

segment.source: Which networking technology?
segment.target: Which networking technology?

segment.source: A quick overview of the networking technologies available for UWP apps, with suggestions on how to choose the technologies that are the best fit for your app.
segment.target: A quick overview of the networking technologies available for UWP apps, with suggestions on how to choose the technologies that are the best fit for your app.

segment.source: XML and SOAP serialization
segment.target: XML and SOAP serialization

segment.source: XML serialization converts objects into an XML stream that conforms to a specific XML Schema definition language (XSD).
segment.target: XML serialization converts objects into an XML stream that conforms to a specific XML Schema definition language (XSD).

segment.source: To convert between XML and a strongly-typed class, you can use the native XDocument class, or an external library.
segment.target: To convert between XML and a strongly-typed class, you can use the native XDocument class, or an external library.

segment.source: JSON serialization
segment.target: JSON serialization

segment.source: JSON (JavaScript object notation) serialization is a popular format for communicating with REST APIs.
segment.target: JSON (JavaScript object notation) serialization is a popular format for communicating with REST APIs.

segment.source: The Newtonsoft Json.NET, which is fully supported for UWP apps.
segment.target: The Newtonsoft Json.NET, which is fully supported for UWP apps.

segment.source: Devices
segment.target: Devices

segment.source: In order to integrate with line-of-business tools, like printers, barcode scanners, or smart card readers, you may find it necessary to integrate external devices or sensors into your app.
segment.target: In order to integrate with line-of-business tools, like printers, barcode scanners, or smart card readers, you may find it necessary to integrate external devices or sensors into your app.

segment.source: Here are some examples of features that you can add to your app using the technology described in this section.
segment.target: Here are some examples of features that you can add to your app using the technology described in this section.

segment.source: Topic
segment.target: Topic

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Enumerate devices
segment.target: Enumerate devices

segment.source: This article explains how to use the Windows.Devices.Enumeration namespace to find devices that are internally connected to the system, externally connected, or detectable over wireless or networking protocols.
segment.target: This article explains how to use the Windows.Devices.Enumeration namespace to find devices that are internally connected to the system, externally connected, or detectable over wireless or networking protocols.

segment.source: Start here if you're building any app that works with devices.
segment.target: Start here if you're building any app that works with devices.

segment.source: Printing and scanniing
segment.target: Printing and scanniing

segment.source: Describes how to print and scan from your app, including connecting to and working with business devices like point-of-sale (POS) systems, receipt printers, and high-capacity feeder scanners.
segment.target: Describes how to print and scan from your app, including connecting to and working with business devices like point-of-sale (POS) systems, receipt printers, and high-capacity feeder scanners.

segment.source: Bluetooth
segment.target: Bluetooth

segment.source: In addition to using traditional Bluetooth connections to send and receive data or control devices, Windows 10 enables using Bluetooth Low Energy (BTLE) to send or receive beacons in the background.
segment.target: In addition to using traditional Bluetooth connections to send and receive data or control devices, Windows 10 enables using Bluetooth Low Energy (BTLE) to send or receive beacons in the background.

segment.source: Use this to display notifications or enable functionality when a user gets close to or leaves a particular location.
segment.target: Use this to display notifications or enable functionality when a user gets close to or leaves a particular location.

segment.source: Device targeting
segment.target: Device targeting

segment.source: Many users today are bringing their own phone or tablet to work, which have varying form factors and screen sizes.
segment.target: Many users today are bringing their own phone or tablet to work, which have varying form factors and screen sizes.

segment.source: With the Universal Windows Platform (UWP), you can write a single line-of-business app that runs seamlessly on all different types of devices, including desktop PCs and PPI displays, allowing you to maximize the reach of your app and the efficiency of your code.
segment.target: With the Universal Windows Platform (UWP), you can write a single line-of-business app that runs seamlessly on all different types of devices, including desktop PCs and PPI displays, allowing you to maximize the reach of your app and the efficiency of your code.

segment.source: Topic
segment.target: Topic

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Guide to UWP apps
segment.target: Guide to UWP apps

segment.source: In this introductory guide, you'll get acquainted with the Windows 10UWP platform, including: what a device family is and how to decide which one to target, new UI controls and panels that allow you to adapt your UI to different device form factors, and how to understand and control the API surface that is available to your app.
segment.target: In this introductory guide, you'll get acquainted with the Windows 10UWP platform, including: what a device family is and how to decide which one to target, new UI controls and panels that allow you to adapt your UI to different device form factors, and how to understand and control the API surface that is available to your app.

segment.source: Adaptive XAML UI code sample
segment.target: Adaptive XAML UI code sample

segment.source: This code sample shows all the possible layout options and controls for your app, regardless of device type, and allows you to interact with the panels to show how to achieve any layout you are looking for.
segment.target: This code sample shows all the possible layout options and controls for your app, regardless of device type, and allows you to interact with the panels to show how to achieve any layout you are looking for.

segment.source: In addition to showing how each control responds to different form factors, the app itself is responsive and shows various methods for achieving adaptive UI.
segment.target: In addition to showing how each control responds to different form factors, the app itself is responsive and shows various methods for achieving adaptive UI.

segment.source: Deployment
segment.target: Deployment

segment.source: You have options for distributing apps to your organization’s users.
segment.target: You have options for distributing apps to your organization’s users.

segment.source: You can use Windows Store for Business, existing mobile device management or you can sideload apps to devices.
segment.target: You can use Windows Store for Business, existing mobile device management or you can sideload apps to devices.

segment.source: You can also make your apps available to the general public by publishing to the Windows Store.
segment.target: You can also make your apps available to the general public by publishing to the Windows Store.

segment.source: Topic
segment.target: Topic

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Distribute LOB apps to enterprises
segment.target: Distribute LOB apps to enterprises

segment.source: You can publish line-of-business apps directly to enterprises for volume acquisition via the Windows Store for Business, without making the apps broadly available to the public.
segment.target: You can publish line-of-business apps directly to enterprises for volume acquisition via the Windows Store for Business, without making the apps broadly available to the public.

segment.source: Sideload apps
segment.target: Sideload apps

segment.source: When you sideload an app, you deploy a signed app package to a device.
segment.target: When you sideload an app, you deploy a signed app package to a device.

segment.source: You maintain the signing, hosting, and deployment of these apps.
segment.target: You maintain the signing, hosting, and deployment of these apps.

segment.source: The process for sideloading apps is streamlined for Windows 10.
segment.target: The process for sideloading apps is streamlined for Windows 10.

segment.source: Publish apps to the Windows store
segment.target: Publish apps to the Windows store

segment.source: The unified Windows Store lets you publish and manage all of your apps for all Windows devices.
segment.target: The unified Windows Store lets you publish and manage all of your apps for all Windows devices.

segment.source: Customize your app’s availability with per-market pricing, distribution and visibility controls, and other options.
segment.target: Customize your app’s availability with per-market pricing, distribution and visibility controls, and other options.

segment.source: Patterns and practices
segment.target: Patterns and practices

segment.source: Code bases for large scale, enterprise-grade apps can become unwieldy.
segment.target: Code bases for large scale, enterprise-grade apps can become unwieldy.

segment.source: Prism is a framework for building loosely coupled, maintainable, and testable XAML applications in WPF, Windows 10 UWP, and Xamarin Forms.
segment.target: Prism is a framework for building loosely coupled, maintainable, and testable XAML applications in WPF, Windows 10 UWP, and Xamarin Forms.

segment.source: Prism provides an implementation of a collection of design patterns that are helpful in writing well-structured and maintainable XAML applications, including MVVM, dependency injection, commands, EventAggregator, and others.
segment.target: Prism provides an implementation of a collection of design patterns that are helpful in writing well-structured and maintainable XAML applications, including MVVM, dependency injection, commands, EventAggregator, and others.

segment.source: For more information on Prism, see the GitHub repo.
segment.target: For more information on Prism, see the GitHub repo.
